cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across the north-western Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast, then inland through Louisiana and central Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City-Marsh Island area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast from Texas/Louisiana border eastward across Louisiana and coastal Mississippi into southwest Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Gale-force winds (35-45 mph with higher gusts) could reach the port late Friday night into Saturday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate coastal flooding possible due to above-normal tides, locally 2–4 ft above ground level
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 2–4 inches with localized 8 inch totals; flash-flood risk for coastal Mississippi
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes overnight Friday into Saturday; rough seas and hazardous navigation conditions in approaches and anchorages
